question: However, usually I would just, you know, choose to go back to my hometown to see my parents.
transcript: You know, just hang around with them, help them with the chores, I guess. you know, on the flip side, if I, if my day is kind of gloomy or if I feel out of sorts, you know, spending time for myself is probably my go-to choice.

grammar.why_not_9: Relies heavily on discourse markers 'you know' (filler/connector overuse) which slightly detracts from total coherence/fluency, though grammar itself is strong.
grammar.why_not_7: Structures are error-free and show sophisticated control of conditionals and phrasal verbs.

vocabulary.why_not_9: Good idiomatic range ('out of sorts', 'flip side'), but 'you know' repetition limits the perception of effortless precision.
vocabulary.why_not_7: Lexical resource is clearly above Band 7 due to natural use of multiple idiomatic phrases without error.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free. Occasional inappropriacies occur.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Skilful use of less common and idiomatic items despite occasional inaccuracies.

vocab_reason: Candidate uses a high density of natural idioms ('hang around', 'flip side', 'out of sorts', 'go-to choice') correctly. This indicates Band 8+. Repetitive use of fillers prevents a solid 9.
grammar_reason: Sentences are error-free and complex (conditionals). Control is sustained. Band 8 is justified.

question: Do you enjoy cooking?
transcript: I really love cooking much as my cooking skills is not so good. I mean, judging my cooking skills, I only give it like a five out of ten. However, you know, I really love going into the kitchen to cook some meals for myself since it is kind of my only time in, you know, a normal day when I can be myself, you know, releasing some stress, recharging my battery, And maybe, reflecting on some, you know, past events during the day.

grammar.why_not_9: Contains a clear error: 'my cooking skills is not so good' (subject-verb agreement).
grammar.why_not_7: Despite the error, the range of complex structures (concession, gerund phrases) is wide and generally well-controlled.

vocabulary.why_not_9: Good collocations ('recharging battery'), but lacks the nuance and total flexibility of Band 9.
vocabulary.why_not_7: Uses idiomatic language effectively and accurately.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Uses a variety of complex structures. Produces frequent error-free sentences. Has good control of grammar and punctuation but may make a few errors.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully, with occasional inaccuracies.

vocab_reason: Strong collocation use ('recharging my battery', 'releasing stress'). Meets Band 8 criteria for lexical resource.
grammar_reason: Complex structures are present ('much as...', 'since it is...'), but the S-V agreement error ('skills is') pulls it down from Band 8 to a strong Band 7.

question: How often do you cook at home?
transcript: even though cooking is one of my favorite things to do, I just do not cook much, you know, during the day since I spend most of my time, you know, at work or at school. So probably, you know, my breakfast and my lunch usually revolve around, you know, either takeout or, you know, some bowl of fuzz or like some box of sticky rice that I bought at the nearby, you know, street vendors. I only cook when in, you know, when I arrive in my house in the evening.

grammar.why_not_9: Heavily fragmented by fillers ('you know'), reducing the 'natural' feel of the control. Structures are accurate but not overly flexible.
grammar.why_not_7: Error-free sentences with good subordination ('even though', 'since').

vocabulary.why_not_9: Vocabulary is accurate but lacks the sophistication/rarity required for Band 9.
vocabulary.why_not_7: Phrasal verb 'revolve around' and topic-specific 'street vendors' show good range.

grammar_reason: grammatically accurate, but the excessive use of 'you know' disrupts the flow and complexity. Solid Band 7.

question: Do you think it is important to make plans before doing something?
transcript: For me, you know, setting plans before doing anything, especially when you really need to attain something really important, like a goal or something. I think it is really crucial for, you know, for all of us. Because a plan is like a set of guidelines or instructions, which not only help you stay on top of everything, but, you know, but it also helps you kind of put the right energy, the right effort into the right task instead of just doing everything without any directions.

grammar.why_not_9: Sentence structure, while complex, feels slightly repetitive and disjointed due to fillers.
grammar.why_not_7: Successful use of 'not only... but also' and relative clauses without error.

vocabulary.why_not_9: Lacks the high-level precision of Band 9.
vocabulary.why_not_7: Idioms like 'stay on top of everything' and 'attain a goal' are well-chosen.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free. Occasional inappropriacies occur.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Skilful use of less common and idiomatic items despite occasional inaccuracies.

vocab_reason: Strong collocations ('stay on top of', 'attain a goal'). Band 8.
grammar_reason: Complex structures handled well ('not only... but also'). Error-free. Band 8.

question: What are the advantages of making plans with other people?
transcript: I think the most obvious advantage when you, you know, adjust your own plans to match other people's needs is that you will, you know, gain reciprocity with them. I mean, it is really hard to put it, but maybe for example, if you, alter your plans to help a person, you know, so basically you guys can just, coordinate with each other better. And of course, not only can you help that guy or that girl, but, you know, but also you can receive their help, you know, in return. So basically, it kind of creates a win-win situation.

grammar.why_not_9: Slight hesitancy disrupts the flow of the complex inversion ('not only can you help...').
grammar.why_not_7: Uses inversion ('not only can you') correctly, which is a Band 8+ feature.

vocabulary.why_not_9: Phrase 'gain reciprocity' is excellent but slightly academic for Part 1? No, it's fine. 'Win-win situation' is also good. Close to 9, but 'that guy or that girl' is a bit imprecise.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free. Occasional inappropriacies occur.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a wide range of vocabulary readily and flexibly to convey precise meaning.

grammar_reason: Successful use of inversion ('not only can you...') demonstrates high-level control. Band 8.

question: Why do some people dislike following a plan?
transcript: Technically there are many cases when you know we see so many people who are not fond of following a plan And I think it all comes down to their in I like their personality because if a person who is inherently adventurous I think they would really they would just embrace the risk and they just love enjoy the adrenaline rush when they face or encounter any kinds of problems on the other hand, maybe the reason behind those who really like following plans is that they prefer stability. So they just do not want to change anything.

grammar.why_not_9: Sentence structure is a bit loose/run-on. 'If a person who is... I think they would...' (redundant relative pronoun/mixed structure).

vocabulary.why_not_9: Very strong collocations ('adrenaline rush', 'inherently adventurous'), but coherence lags slightly behind lexical quality.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Uses a variety of complex structures. Has good control of grammar and punctuation but may make a few errors.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Skilful use of less common and idiomatic items despite occasional inaccuracies.

grammar_reason: Structure error: 'if a person who is... I think they would...' (mixed construction). Keeps it at Band 7.

question: Do you think young people and older people plan things differently?
transcript: I think the main, you know, distinctions between how, younger generations and older generations plan for their own things is that, you know, the first one is, probably about, About the, you know, about the goals that they set. when it comes to the younger generations, their goals might be, you know, much more, much in the short term. Not really in the long term like the older generations. and those goals are usually more materialistic compared to the, to the older generations. And maybe the second distinction, probably, you know, in terms of the practicality of the goals and also the ability to, you know, cope with some variables in the, you know, during the process of doing that plan. because older generations tend to have an enrich, knowledge and experiences since they have encountered many things in their life. So they will be more thoughtful in terms of planning and of course they will have, they will come up with several solutions for, you know, for problems which can incur during the process. On the other hand, you know, the younger generations might not be so ready for, you know, problems. And they, I think they are more prone to variables when they kind of occur.

anti_overrating.reason: Uses high-level words ('variables', 'incur') but 'incur' is used incorrectly (should be 'occur' or 'arise'). 'Enrich knowledge' should be 'enriched'.

grammar.why_not_9: Errors present: 'have an enrich knowledge' (adjective form).
grammar.why_not_7: Deep complexity and sustained control over a long turn.

vocabulary.why_not_9: Imprecise use of 'incur' (problems incur? usually costs incur, problems occur) and 'enrich' (should be enriched).
vocabulary.why_not_7: Despite errors, the range is vast ('materialistic', 'practicality', 'variables').

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Produces frequent error-free sentences. Has good control of grammar and punctuation but may make a few errors.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully, with occasional inaccuracies.

vocab_reason: High-level vocabulary attempts ('variables', 'practicality'). Errors ('incur', 'enrich') are 'occasional inaccuracies' allowed in Band 8. Risk-taking is high.
grammar_reason: Structure is generally good, but 'have an enrich knowledge' is a basic error. Length implies Part 3 style in Part 1. Band 7.

question: Do you think people are less committed to goals now than in the past?
transcript: I think it depends on the people you are looking at. Generally we are a bit less pressured I would say than our parents or even grandparents because they were really, you know, committed in order to have jobs, in order to have opportunities. So I think that nowadays some people tend to, yeah, are not really complete and fulfill their promises. But others are also seeing promises as a way to, you know, become entrepreneurs and to create new opportunities for themselves. So I guess it is a half-half.

grammar.why_not_9: 'tend to... are not really complete' (mixed structure). 'Tend to be' or 'Tend not to complete'.

vocabulary.why_not_9: 'half-half' is a bit informal/unnatural (fifty-fifty?). 'Complete promises' is awkward (keep promises?).

question: Okay, and do young people show commitment towards work if they are not paid well?
transcript: It is true. Maybe wages and salaries can influence the way we are committed to work, for example. I would say that we need to be committed no matter the amount of money we will earn in the end. But maybe yes this can influence the level of commitment especially with young people Some are struggling for example with money issues So it is an important criteria for them So I think your commitment needs to be you know applied no matter the salary you will receive Okay, and how can we teach young children to be committed to their goals and never give up? I guess, it starts at a young age. We need to basically share with them those values because some people sometimes were not told about them. so having, for example, at school this frame in which young kids can learn that being committed in the end is worth it. Because usually people, they are not committed enough because they think it will not work in the end. So if you show them that no matter what happens, it is worth it, then they will tend to be more committed in the end. OK, thank you so much.

question: Have you shared anything recently with other people?
transcript: a lot because from my childhood my parents have taught me a very well lesson that I have to share with people. So most of the time I am really willing to share my food, my clothes, or my personal belongings to my friends or my beloved ones.

question: Alright, and what are the advantages of manufacturing consumer goods in your own country?
transcript: The habits for the consumers to purchase products in their own country. So, well, they are not finding other brands in other countries and, well, that will formalize a Brandship or flagship for the country. And so they will view their the products in within the nation more authentically than before Alright Okay I agree And in your opinion have we become too upset nowadays with owning the latest products Why and why not Well, in general, yes. and a prime, a prime example should be named is iPhone. Actually, I do not understand too. I cannot perceive why people are so crazy about buying the newest and the biggest iPhone. For example, the iPhone 16 now. They had to buy the Pro Max type. And well, I think it is can be attributed to commercials when they could not stop advertising their products as the newest or the most innovative. So that on the spur of the moment, customers will desire to own that product. And that leads to excessive consuming. Yeah, you make it sound like a mental disorder.

question: The first question is, is it important to have a break during work or study?
transcript: from my perspective, I think having breaks is compulsory because we are, we are human. We are not machines and even machines need to have times break time and, it needs to be taken care of. So when people work or study for a long time, for example, like five to six hours, they do need a break, like at least an hour break. Maybe go for lunch, take a walk, or just play some music so they can, relax down. And I think if they do not take breaks during those work, they will be burnt out and exhausted. So it will greatly affect their productivity and maybe have some negative outcome.

grammar.why_not_9: Minor slip 'relax down' (relax or calm down).

vocabulary.why_not_9: 'relax down' is slightly unnatural. 'during those work' (that work).

question: Okay, if you are ready, could you begin speaking about it?
transcript: Yes, so my topic was to talk about a company that I do know. And the first one that came to my mind was Samsung, because we are here in Korea. And for sure, it is one of the largest companies in the world. So everyone knows about it. And what I found it successful about Samsung, and I actually started about it when I was young, it was one of my teachers when I was in high school. And it was very fascinating to get to know how and how he got successful because if I am not wrong, the CEO in the beginning was selling rice cakes and he got so, you know, he was very, determined to succeed. So, I always find it very, very fascinating. And, however, when it comes to the working environment, I have a lot of friends that work for Samsung and it is very competitive. And, I mean, this is probably my personal opinion, but I, I do think it is, it is not one of the best working environment. it is very hard. it is, it is tough. You have to work for a lot of Howard and even just to get in. I know that the selection, they have like four interviewers. So I do not know if I would work there, but for sure it is a very successful company. And, what I would say is like different from any other company when it comes to Samsung is that they sell everything. Like you can go to a Samsung store and just to buy a TV or, of course a phone and you can also buy a fridge or I do not know, like an air conditioner. So it is something that I always find so, unique and something that is very different from most of other competitors when it comes to, companies and organizations.

grammar.why_not_9: 'work for a lot of Howard' -> 'hours'? Transcription error likely, but structure is loose. 'what I found it successful' (found successful about it).

So, people do care so much about it and the working environment is so selective, but it is also like, engaging. that is also what I love about Italian food company. question: Why do some people like you choose to work at an international company or international organization?
transcript: Oh, that is what I ask myself a lot too. I think most of the people that choose my major, they choose it because they want to change something. At least we believe we want to change how the things work. And we want also to raise awareness. Like what I try to do, by studying and, by talking with my friends is always like to try to make people understand how things actually are and how many stereotypes we do have, in terms of our, like politics and our environment and everything related. Like for example, nowadays even related to, health and like, you know, the vaccine and everything. So I do believe, that reading and studying and mostly discussing with people helps. And that is why most of people choose to work for international organization because it kind of feels like you actually changing people's minds and you make them believe that something can change and we can do it together. So. Yeah, that definitely sounds like a great reason to join an international organization. Okay, thank you so much for answering all my questions. transcript: This might sound strange, but I prefer rainy weather whenever it is big rain or just small droplets of water. vocabulary.why_not_9: 'whenever it is watery' (wet/rainy?). Watery usually describes soup/eyes.

question: And how does the weather affect your plans?
transcript: I would not say it has a big impact on my plans since I mostly plan my schedule indoors and I do not go outside much since I have a lot of my plates and I have been snow under a lot of pressures and homework so I have not got time to go out yet so I usually just plan things indoors. I do not go outside that much so.

question: What environmental problems are common in your area?
transcript: I would say noise pollution. Oh, and they are a, you know, a company near my house. And whenever it is nighttime, they usually have those big cars that will transport all the goods, all the food and stuff into that company. So it makes really loud noises, especially at midnight. And I cannot sleep. And let my hair down after a tiring day at work. Because of it.

grammar.why_not_9: 'they are a... company' (there is a). Fragments at end.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

grammar_reason: Basic error ('they are' for 'there is'). Band 6.

question: Governments, companies, or individuals?
transcript: That is an interesting question because I think all of them have a role in polluting one area. But mainly it because of their residents Because they mostly live there and all the garbage mostly come from households and such things So I think that household like the folds are responsible for most of the waste and garbage in one area And what measures can be taken to reduce the use of plastic? I think that reducing plastic, they come from small things, not really big ones. For example, you learn how to recycle, reduce, reuse stuffs, and try to find a new way to use all of the ways that you are planning to dump down the environment. you can, well, spread the information of recycling things. we are using things to others, teaching young children to drink in bottles that they bring, not in plastic ones.

anti_overrating.reason: 'mainly it because' (it is because). 'garbage mostly come' (comes). 'dump down the environment' (dump in?). 'reuse stuffs' (stuff - uncountable).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

So, teaching children is a very important way and teach them that, polluting the environment can really take a toll on their lives, can really make a big impact.
